title: Quick96 or SaeHD have RTX 3070 selected, but don't seem to assign any workload to my GPU
body:
## Expected behavior
Open latest RTX3000 Build of DFL 2.0
GPU Selected in Quck96 or SaeHD Train is RTX 3070
Workload assigned to GPU
HWMonitor Shows high GPU and VRAM usage
Fast training compared to CPU selected

*Describe, in some detail, what you are trying to do and what the output is that you expect from the program.*
I'm literally just trying to get the program to use my GPU. I have tried many times and made sure I have not accidentally chosen my CPU for the workload.

## Actual behavior
Open latest RTX3000 Build of DFL 2.0
GPU Selected in Quck96 or SaeHD Train is RTX 3070
Workload apparently assigned to CPU instead, even though it says RTX 3070 in the .bin window
HWMonitor Shows 0-2% GPU usage, 80% VRAM usage, 99-100% CPU usage
Same train rate as CPU selected

*Describe, in some detail, what the program does instead. Be sure to include any error message or screenshots.*
It would appear that my VRAM is being used, but the workload is still being processed by my CPU and not my GPU.

## Steps to reproduce
Open latest RTX3000 Build of DFL 2.0 and run it with an RTX 3070 installed.

*Describe, in some detail, the steps you tried that resulted in the behavior described above.*

## Other relevant information
Operating system: Windows 10 build 19042
Python version: 3.6.4
Cuda 11.2 installed
